header.title: Discrimination against age

header.postText: For school, we had to make a digital story on a discrimination topic...mine is age (discrimination against age)

commentThread.commentText: I pray to God somebody will respect me enough to employ me before unemployment does kill me.
OMG thank you for this!  I am an older person just barely hanging on to hope. I was a good employed but I was cut..  I'm barely surviving.
No. Children don't mimic what they see on tv/videogames/any form of entertainment.

'Despite the fact the United States' Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA) has been in place for over 35 years, age discrimination in employment remains pervasive.'~ Laurie McCann , Senior attorney, AARP Litigation Foundation… 'Negative perceptions of older workers were perceived as inflexible, unwilling to adapt technology, lacking an aggressive spirit, resistant to new ways, having some physical limitations, costing more for health insurance and complacent… Typically 90% of age discrimination suits do not make it to trial… One reason is t hat age discrimination in the employment process is difficult to prove'… [LINK]

Respect starts at home and not to totally blame TV for misbehaved kids! It all starts when parents are against spanking their kid's asses to teach them respect. I have 2 grandsons and they know better not to disrespect me. All I have to do is give them both a certain look and stare and they know what is up and what I will do next if they don't act right. Result? I get lots of love and respect from them both and my daughters have to highest respect because I brought them up the same way like my grandsons.

Ohhhh this makes me very mad is you said a curtain race mimics what they see on tv that is a huge generalisation and I am incredibly mad you said that and you said all children act this way you sir/madam are a hippocrit
Great video!  People of all ages need to realize that respect is a two way street.  You have to give respect to get respect.  Remember, your example is the biggest influence you have on others.

Many people abuse in several time or everytime. The unlawful to harass a person because of his or her age.  Unlawful age discrimination happens when someone is treated unfavourably because of thei r age, without justification, or is harassed or victimised because of the ir age. We can include fighting youn ger age than them, bullying, punishing, and hardtalk. If your child cadger a bread will you give him or her a punch?  Harassment includes behaviour that is offensive, frightening or in any way distressing. It may be intentional bullying which is obvious or violent, but can also be unintentional, subtle and insidious. No culture was exempt from the problem, and no culture can claim to be exempt today. While we've made dishearteningly little progress, at least we've started taking a relatively clear-eyed look at the groups that are affected and the situations in which discrimination occurs. At least we're willing to acknowledge discrimination as a problem, although we can't even be trusted to get that right much of the time. But do you believe that  every life is valuable? This age discrimination can cause a war and can cause of death.
" Oh, I wish I was young again". if you were in THIS society, you would give anything to be a adult again.

i actually broke my mouse (not kidding, seriously) when i saw this. 1:00 Kids are not stupid because of age.They dont mimic stuff because of age. im probably smarter than a lot of you adults, and have better grammar. kids act like that because they get mad when they say "Hey guys i think i saw something over there!" and they are then ignored. We Go to this behavior because YOU disrespect US. We also deserve the right of speech. we need all the rights in the constitution, freedom for ALL. it also made me mad when i went to staples to get a new mouse, and told my mom to stay in the car. that i could handle it. then at the cashier th e woman said "sorry honey, you need a adult with you. your too young." i don't think that was in the store policy. what was that? it was her bei ng ageist. i should have b een racist to her, but i wasn't. couse' i was the lil' nice kid. Martin Luther king and Abe Lincoln freed colored people. Cezar Chaves helped the latins. I want to be the next in the list to free young and experienced people, they don't have rights. Experienced people have to go to homes, and kids are forced to take some subjects at school they don't want to. i could list other stuff, but im just going to put etc. someone help put a stop to this.
your the best i couldnt find an ageism video then i finally found your video this is an awsome video your awsome

It's wrong when you discriminate SOLELY on age. If someone is equally as qualified to do something, it's wrong to forbid them from doing it. The child wouldn't have the proper training to do so nor the proper reasoning capabilities of driving said tank. As for the man, it would simply be a threat to the children for him to be there *shrugs*
Qualifications over age anytime anywhere. "You cannot gamble if under 21?" That's a ridiculous law, anyone who's qualified should gamble

Great video. Thanks for putting an emphasis on the fact that we all deserve respect, no matter what age we are. Keep up the good work. And remember: First you are young; then you are middle-aged; then you are old; then you are wonderful. - Lady Diana Cooper

Thank you so much for your message, it is beautiful, I'm going to illustrate a short presentation on Ageism at Psychology class - Stereotypes and Prejudice at Curry College, Milton, MA. I hope you don't mind, I could never make a video like your. Happy Holidays, Merry Christmas and Happy New Year. Denise.

Age discrimination is age discrimination reguardless of what the conditions and or circumstances are, you ether do it or you do not, Example: 50 year old man want to go back to kindergarden Example 2: 5 yea r old wants to drive a fully armed nuclear tank Now what is the primairy reason why these people will not be allowed to do what they want?

that picture of the fellow wearing a blue shirt and jamming his finger into the face of a seated and scared older man really made me feel bad. Where is that from if you don't mind me asking?
great video by the way.  :)
